title: Reviving the MVP: How CompetitionSuitShop Going Back on Track
description:
CompetitionSuitShop was founded to offer bodybuilding competition suits at competitive prices globally. Its key edge lies in variety and a unique 3D configuration shopping experience. 

 During past few months, an abnormal increase in bounce-rate was noticed, while inspection based on findings steps were taken which how we takled is discussed below.

content.subtitle: Problem Discovery
content.subcontent:
1. Customer often raised questions asking if the product listed on website is 2nd hand? Concerns were primarly because of the pricing compared to our competitors were lesser than expected. 

 2. Can customer get same product designs for different competition catgories? Because each category has their own rules and guidelines. 

 3. Too many repetitive questions during Consulation sessions cuasing excessive exhausion over aviodable matters.

content.subtitle: Goals
content.subcontent:
1. Make customers understand that every product is bespoke / customizable and made to order. 

 2. Strategically reduce avoidable Consulation booking. 

 3. Improve user experience in noticable flows with possibility of high user touchpoints.

content.subtitle: Approach
content.subcontent:
Based on Usability Testing, previously registered Personas and customer Usage Pattern around the product purchasing experience (before and after purchase), the sharable work is discussed below in detail. 

 One business model suggestion is also included which i think will be of great use, but because the current code is not suitable to scale, it is much harder to get it implemented by the Devs.

snapshots.imgDesc: Potential Upselling, Reselling and Partnership Opportunities
snapshots.imgCont:
User dont make account before purchasing as 1 customer generally order 1 suit a year. 

 Product page is responsible to collect data, thats how we reach out to our users. Because of this, sometimes it increases risk of customer loosing patience and delay in purchase or even loose interest. 

 How we can make this flow hassle free without extra cost over incentives/promo and making users appreciate our service? 

 We already provide free accessories and special discounts, some of them are visible and some are hidden. We can make a "Referral Program" stating both the parties after accepting invitation can enjoy bonus add-ons with their next purchase for our New customers and for Existing customer to avail their Special Code Promo which gives them discount on their next purchase as a Thank You gesture for being a fellow Competitors trusting us since thier carrers beginning. 

 This might attrack new competitors, since the competition itself is buidling itself to attract new people in this domain.

snapshots.imgTitle: Product Detail Page: Stating what's considered obvious, but isn't
snapshots.imgDesc: As a Ecommerce product page, it is essential to convey all the details related to the product that perfectly describes the quality and details of the product
snapshots.imgCont:
Every neiche product has its own way to attract and gain confidence of their customer. Thats our primary objective and following changes were made in order to achieve it: 

 1. Replacing "Available" from "Viewed by 22.5K people". 

 2. Cute CTA to Instagram DM, as currently its our primary touchpoint with customers. 

 3. Ignoring the Description section as it's currently used for SEO, and introducing "Product Details" section to give a better overview of its Category and cutomizable availability detail to the customer.

snapshots.imgTitle: Blog / Knowledgebase: Beginners friendly accessible content
snapshots.imgDesc: Beginners are currently most overwhelmed and spend more time doing research over every competition category
snapshots.imgCont:
The most recoded session hour is on our Blogs section and is the most valuable space where new competitors spend their time on. Using this to gain their confidence as we help them achieve their goal effeciently is best way to support the community. 

 Optimizing it such that a specific information can be pulled out of all the articles can be a good way to make them a potential customer through sales and consultancy.

snapshots.imgDesc: Less clutter increases chance of making decision quickly
snapshots.imgCont:
The market is cluttered and requires users to make their life simpler by making it easy to use and decide. Following changes were made to optimize the flow and to reduce congitive load: 

 1. Adjusting Color Contrast to improve visibility

 We introduced a tertiary brand color to enhance visibility while preserving the existing brand identity, ensuring accessibility for users with partial vision impairment

 2. Shorten hand movement & White space balancing

 In UX terms, I implemented Fitts's Law, which emphasizes designing to minimize travel distance for common actions, resulting in reduced hand movement and a more intuitive ordering process.

snapshots.imgTitle: Marketing Strategy: Sometimes being cretive pays off
snapshots.imgDesc: Friendly content with some humour with trends can catch attention quickly
snapshots.imgCont:
Making relatable content with a punch of humour is the latest trend is whats working at the moment on Instagram and its never too late to enter the market like this. The more engaging and valuable the post can be, the better chancess of it reaching to the right people. 

 Welcome to the era of algorithm.

conclusion.conclusionDesc:
1. Improved customer satisfaction 

 2. Reduced inquiries about product authenticity, and reduced bounce rate by 10%. 

 3. Improved after purchase experience.

note.noteTitle: Note to self & whoever is reading
note.noteDesc:
> After working on a product for long enough, user persona helps stay on track to remember the behavior of the target audience.It prevents us from taking any biased decisions.

 > Interacting directly with customer can save a lot of time.

 > Frequent and drastic changes can be too stressful for existing customer, so be mindful about it when doing A/B testing.
